alert.note: Alert for Greenville (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 28 at 6:24AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Parts of Greenville county in upstate South Carolina. * WHEN...Until 900 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 619 AM EDT, Many streams across central and southern Greenville County will remain elevated and out of their banks this morning. FLooding of low-lying along rivers and streams, including but not limited to the Reedy, Enoree and Saluda River basins, and select tributaries such as Gilder Creek will continue. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
